intro: Columellia oblonga subsp. serrata, commonly known as the serrated columellia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
